SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

gov.nih.nlm.meme.sql
Class Version

java.lang.Object
  gov.nih.nlm.meme.sql.Version
public class Version
extends Object

The Version class provides package version information for gov.nih.nlm.meme.sql package. History

08/15/2005:
Suppressible implementation.
06/17/2005:
LongAttributeHandler makes use of new mrd_stringtab table structure. MappingMapper improved. MEMEConnection includes small changes for better handling of map sets.
03/25/2005:
Ticket's getReportsTicket method now adds a data restriction clause for attributes to ignore XMAP, XMAPTO and XMAPFROm attributes. This should make reading map set concepts for Jekyll or the concept reports considerably faster.
03/11/2005:
AttributeMapper and LongAttributeMapper show the source of a context when formatting it, not just the source of the atom it is connected to. ActionEngine code cleaned up a little bit. ResultSetIterator handles errors better.
01/25/2005:
ActionEngine fix for stamping. Read all concepts into a list before approving. This should prevent "fetch out of sequence" error. MEMEConnection improvements to cui assignment algorithm. MIDConnection reports better errors when a worklist/checklist cannot be read properly.
01/14/2005:
LongAttributeMapper shows attribute_id in error messages. MEMEConnectionQueries uses a non-null tobereleased value when the preferred atom on the other side of a rel cannot be found. ValidatingActionEngine does not try to re-read target concept after undoing a split. Various mappers were updated to use java.util.Date objects instead of java.sql.Date or java.sql.Timestamp objects.
12/13/2004:
ActionEngine has more rigorous methodology for handling actions and inter-operating with MRD. MEMEDataSourceFactory accepts a name like "apollo.lexical.com_apelon" where it is machine/sid separated by _. If this form exists without a _, it is assumed that the machine has the suffix ".nlm.nih.gov". MEMEConnectionQueries does not refer to operations_queue. MeshEntryTermMapper ignores MSH translations. MIDDataSource and MEMEDataSource now use findActions instead of findAuxiliaryDataActions. In fact, use of AuxiliaryDataAction has been entirely deprecated. MEMEDataSource and MEMEConnection also have deprecated use of the aux data action. Also code pertaining to work logs was moved to MEMEConnection/MEMEDataSource.
11/05/2004:
New MIDActionEngine to support the MEMEDataSourceAction and MIDDataSourceAction. ConceptMappingMapper now reads from cui_map and does not pretend to be a RelationshipMapper. this is a much cleaner solution. MEMEConnectionQueries explicitly restricts atoms to dead='N' when reading "atoms with names". ActionEngine has a much cleaner implementation. It does a better job of logging SUI,ISUI,LUI,AUI assignments (and a better job of performing them). Some previous MEMEConnection methods that better belonged here are here. MEMEDataSourceFactory assists in cacheing data at the right time. ValidatingActionEngine now extends MIDActionEngine. MEMEDataSource and MIDDataSource have many new methods for supporting all kinds of auxiliary table changes like editing editor preference information and new sources/termgroups. MEMEConnection and MIDConnection implement all of these new methods. In addition they use a more sophisticated cacheing architecture that segregates caches for different databases (allowing consistency across requests). This is a VERY good improvement. AtomMapper computes rank values instead of using RANK value from classes. This is because classes will now use release termgroup ranks instead of editing termgroup ranks. AttributeMapperand RelationshipMapper do a better job with SG_MEME_ID, SG_MEME_DATA_TYPE info. A bug where attributes were being added twice was fixed.
08/19/2004:
MEMEDataSource and MEMEConnection upgraded to suport new concept mapping API. New class ConceptMappingMapper for reading concept mappings. MEMEConnection does more to close statements upon errors, support the Content View API better.
07/20/2004:
RelationshipMapper does a better job of connecting non-ENG atoms to ENG atoms. MEMEDataSource and MEMEConnection now support setContentView. Also, adding a content view now assigns a unique id from max tab.
07/09/2004:
LongAttributeHandler does a better job of handling errors. New MEMEDataSource methods and MEMEConnection implementations for handling inserts/removals/changes of content views and content view members. Also, bug fix for the code which handles reading the inverse of a relationship.
06/14/2004:
ActionEngine does a better job of closing cursors. MEMEConnection also does a better job of closing cursors and now supports reading of inverse relationships (by rel id). MEMEConnectionQueries was updated to support this function as well. A small MeshEntryTermMapper change was made to only attempt mapping for current version MSH atoms.
05/06/2004:
Ticket and MEMEConnection now support parameters for explicitly including or excluding languages when reading atoms from the MID. ActionEngine and MEMEConnection have a bug fix to prevent deadlocking problem. MEMEConnectionQueries fixes a problem causing duplicate context rels to appear on concept reports. Now we sort unique away by ignoring relationship_id when reading context rels. MIDConnection and MEMEConnection were updated to cache missing relationship attribute values from a new database. Javadocs for a few classes were cleaned up (especially those things used with DataWriter).
04/21/2004:
All calls to new Ticket() were converted to Ticket.getEmptyTicket().
04/19/2004:
Bug fix to ContextRelationshipMapper to add rels as context relationships instead of as regular relationships. Bug fix to AttributeMapper to connect atom to attribute. DataWriter sets the fetch size to increase performance. ResultSetIterator handles exceptions better. RelationshipMapper connects translation atoms. MEMEConnection now fully supports non-ENG atoms. Ticket now supports reading non-ENG atoms (and sets it to true for actions ticket).
03/17/2004:
EnhancedConnection now supports the ability to set/restore the sort and hash area sizes. AttributeMapper and RelationshipMapper were upgraded to support complete mapping of their respective core data types, including finding the things they are attached to. The MEMEConnection was updated to take advantage of this in the various populateXXX methods.
02/20/2004:
MEMEConnection and MEMEConnectionQueries better handle the reading of language from classes, and better management of reading attributes/relationships attached to non-ENG atoms. Bug fix in Ticket for ClassCastException. This fix lead to a patch released 20040219.
02/06/2004:
Most of the changes in this release are here. They include:
  • MIDConnection and MEMEConnection no longer leave open cursors.
  • New mappers: ConceptMapper and MapSetMapper.
  • MEMEConnection now uses a consistent way to build queries for reading core data.
  • MEMEConnection now fully supports mappers for all core data types, in get and populate methods.
  • ContextRelationshipMapper, AttributeMapper and RelationshipMapper are more flexible with respect to whether or not to read CONCEPT_ID and ATOM_ID fields.
  • Ticket was cleaned up and now treats all core data objects consistently (no special exceptions for atoms). Also new options for specifying start/end (to read a range) are aupported
  • MEMEConnection was updated to support all of the new changes and core data client methods.
01/20/2004:
ActionEngine and ValidatingActionEngine were modified to handle/throw StaleDataException. A method for locking concepts (and related concepts) was added to MEMEDataSource and MEMEConnection. MEMEConnection now also sets the read timestamp of a concept when it is populated. MIDConnection now only reads worklist and checklist names where the tables exist. ActionEngine has undergone a number of changes, including: better javadoc comments, better handling of null attribute values when computing md5 hash, implementation of new locking mechanism for molecular actions, validation of data freshness during molecular actions, better locking for undo/redo actions.
12/29/2003:
ActionEngine was passing RUI for source_rui, ATUI for source_atui and AUI for source_atui. We will have to correct the bogus data.
12/15/2003:
Changes to MEMEDataSource and MEMEConnection, Ticket and MappingMapper to support the read-access of mapping objects in the MID.
12/04/2003:
Cosmetic change to MEMEConnection javadocs.
12/01/2003:
ActionEngine now checks nullability of all fields before calling aproc_insert actions. MEMEDataSource and MEMEConnection now have a method to remove events from the operations_queue table (removeFeedbackEvent). The MEMEConnection was also updated to improve some error messages. Finally MappingMapper was implemented to read mapping information properly.
11/07/2003:
ActionEngine does not read the correct concept status when inserting rels. MEMEConnectionQueries, RelationshipMapper, and AttributeMapper now handle the additional relationship/attribute fields (e.g. source_rui).
10/22/2003:
ActionEngine reads the correct concept status before processing batch inserts. This is required because the various insert actions now don't read concept info.
10/22/2003:
MEMEConnectionQueries and AtomMapper now properly read source_cui, source_dui, and source_aui. We should make similar changes to support new relationships and attributes fields. ActionEngine also inserts atom LUIs using the base string.
10/15/2003:
MEMEDataSource and MEMEConnection now throw DataSourceException if the user name cannot be determined. This precipitated changes to ActionEngine as well. Also, MEMEConnection was not failing when trying to populate a non-existent attribute_id, this was fixed.
10/01/2003:
ActionEngine supports new MEME_APROCS procedures This means that the new aprocs must be released with the new code, or we release MEME_APROCS first, let it settle, then release this code. It also no longer manually assigns the AUI in the code, but lets MEME_APROCS handle it. SourceAtomMapper, SourceAttributeMapper, and SourceRelationshipMapper were also extended to support the additional fields parameters.
09/05/2003:
MEMEConnectionQueries was updated to read atomic actions and order by atomic action id. ActionEngine was enabled to pass the MD5 hash of the attribute value to the corresponding atomic action (when inserting an attribute). This was temporarily disabled until the proper MEME_APROCS could be released.
08/25/2003:
MIDConnection was returning concept worklists and checklists with duplicate concepts. The queries were rewritten to produce lists without duplicates.
08/18/2003:
MEMEConnection was fixed to ensure that the related atom of S level rels is ALWAYS set, even if an action ticket is used. MIDConnection fixed to read concept information for dead concepts (for action reports). MolecularActionQueryBuilder now builds action lookup queries to find cases where the concept_id is the target id.
08/06/2003:
MEMEConnectionQueries was updated to read the releasability of the "related atom" of an "atom level" relationship. This allows the ReportsGenerator to show that ostensibly "releasable" relationships are actually not if they are connected to unreleasable atoms. PreferredAtomMapper was upgraded to look for the new tobereleased field in the queries and set it in the atom object being mapped to. There were several changes to ActionEngine. First, we fixed a bug in how AUIs for NLM02 atoms were being assigned (so that it matches MEME_SOURCE_PROCESSING.assign_auis. Second, when dealing with native identifiers, the code now better supports null qualifier values. Third, a bug in the logic for deciding when to recalculate the preferred atom of a concept was fixed. Finally, some poorly chosen method names were changed (private methods).
07/16/2003:
MEMEConnectionQueries, Ticket, and MEMEConnection were updated to read ContextPath information. DoseFormMapper was fixed to correctly read the phase type. ActionEngine only recomputes concept preferred atom if it needs to be recomputed. ContextPathMapper is used to map the context path query to atom objects.
06/27/2003:
The getAtomChecklist, getAtomWorklist, getConceptChecklist, and getConceptWorklist methods should now return every concept on the worklist (in MIDConnection. The queries were changed for the atom worklist/checklist to get every atom in every concept represented by the atoms on a worklist/checklist, instead of just getting every atom on the worklist in its current concept.
06/20/2003:
DoseFormMapper uses the context parent treenumbers to determine if a dose form is liquid or solid, we changed parent treenumbers to use AUIs, so we now updated the mapper to also use auis instead of atom ids.
06/19/2003:
MIDConnection has additional support for integrity system. ActionEngine uses language when assigning string identifiers.
06/06/2003:
MIDConnection and MIDDataSource support better interface with the integrity objects. ActionEngine tracks transaction id for batch actions better and also handles relationship sg_* parameters better.
05/16/2003:
SourceAttributeMapper and SourceRelationshipMapper are sg_id enabled. The Ticket supports a switch for reading non-english atoms. The MEMEConnectionQuery queries for reading classes were updated to support non-ENG rows. MEMEConnection was updated to read/not read non-english atoms based on the ticket switch (populateConcept was updated). ActionEngine was fixed to correctly support aproc_insert_attribute.
05/08/2003:
Expanded support for "native identifiers". The AttributeMapper, RelationshipMapper, ActionEngine, and MEMEConnectionQueries now all deal with these fields. MEMEDataSource and MEMEConnection now have the findMolecularAction methods instead of MIDDataSource and MIDConnection. Additionally, we added getApplicationVectors and getOverrideVectors methods to MIDConnection and MEMEConnection. Also, clustering of worklists and checklists was fixed in MIDConnection.
04/25/2003:
MIDConnection and MEMEConnection now make use of MissingDataException. A MEMEConnection bug in populateAtom which was causing the RxNorm status to be improperly set was fixed. The CoreData getSourceIdentifier method was renamed to be getSrcIdentifier and this change was propagated to ActionEngine.
04/09/2003:
AttributeMapper was fixed to correctly create ConceptSemanticTypes. Changes to MEMEConnection to correctly populate concepts and atoms with self-referential relationships. Streamlining for performance.
04/01/2003:
ActionEngine was cleaned up to prevent null pointer exceptions. A variety of mappers were implemented including PreferredAtomMapper, RelationshipMapper, AttributeMapper, LongAttributeMapper, ContextRelationshipMapper. The MEMEConnection methods for populating core data were standardized to use the mapping functions instead of defining ad-hoc mapping functions. Also reading of relationships with names was made more efficient with additional queries in MEMEConnectionQueries involving an outer join.
03/19/2003:
ActionEngine was made more stable with respect to calling MEME_APROCS. In particular, when translating objects to MEME_APROCS function parameters, we perform a null-check first to ensure that NullPointerExceptions are not thrown. MEMEConnection small bug fix to find methods to support insert.pl. DataWriter uses a higher prefetch value for queries, this is mostly for MRD.
03/05/2003:
Extended the Ticket notion of a AtomMapper to apply to attributes and relationships as well. We implemented "source" mappers which will read from a table with a limited set of fields designed to be inserted from (i.e. insert.pl fields). MEMEConnection was upgraded to take advantage of the ticket changes, and in particular now supports fining/reading of information from arbitrary tables/queries instead of the static core tables, although the default ticket still supports that. ResultSetMapper and ResultSetIterator were updated to support mapping more in the style of the core data mappers. This affects MRD code somewhat.
11/13/2002:
There are four major areas of development:
  1. Methods were added to support lookup of molecular actions by search parameters. This is to support generic "action harvester" functionality.
  2. Methods were also added to support the looking up of "dead" core data. This supports the ability to generate detailed action reports that indicate exactly what it is that an action did.
  3. Support for the RxNorm "branded" data model, however these changes will not be released until the next version.
  4. Support for AUI maintenance.
These development efforts contributed to some significant changes in the builder classes used to create SQL queries for the variuos find* functions of MID/MEME data sources.
08/28/2002:
This relese brings a large number of changes. The AtomMapper architecture was engineered to support a variety of context-specific atom classes. Most notably, the RxNormComponentMapper, RxNormMapper} and DoseFormMapper support data structures used in RxNorm editing. The MIDConnection was significantly upgraded to support a variety of worklist and finder functions to support the new client APIs. Included in this work was the development of a set of QueryBuilder objects for mapping search parameters to queries. Most other changes involve bug fixes, refinements and additional changes to support the new client side APIs.
06/20/2002:
MEMEConnection was fixed to faithfully represnt sources of relationships, even if they are things like E-... These are given all of the attributes of MTH but an SAB of E-... The connection was also upgraded with a variety of findXXX methods that return iteraters over queries allowing applications to lookup data without having to read it all into memory. A rich mechanism for populating atoms outside independently of a concept was built. This is to support applications like the RxNorm editor. Queries were split out of MEMEConnection and put into MEMEConnectionQueries. The Queries for reading atom-level information were added. Queries for reading relationships were changed to allow self-referential (at concept level) relationships to be read in both directions so they could be connected to both atoms. ActionEngine was implemented and debugged. This implementation supports the molecular actions. Ticket was moved from common package. This was to support the whole mechanism for handing the AtomMapper, which allows source-specific atom classes to be created when reading an atom/concept. This mechanism should eventually be extended to all core data.
05/13/2002:
MEMEDataSource and MEMEConnection were upgraded to support ActionEngine implementation. Also, we changed the cacheing strategy for sources and termgroups in MEMEConnection so that an application can request a source that does not exist in the default database and no weird exception is thrown.
04/22/2002:
Significant changes to MEMEConnection and MEMEDataSource to provide enhanced access to the data. Also, changes made by TTN to support MRD were incorporated into MEMEConnection. MEMEDataSourceFactory no longer requires the existence of the various -jdbc service names to operate, it will accept "editing-db" or "oa_mid2003" style mid service names.
04/04/2002:
MEMEDataSourceFactory was setting data source names to things like "oa.nlm.nih.gov_mid2003". This was fixed. MEMEConnection and EnhancedConnection were thorougly reviewed to make sure that all opened statements are explicitly closed.
03/26/2002:
MEMEDataSource and MEMEConnection were extended with add/removeRelationshipAttribute.
11/01/2001:
1st Release.

Author:
MEME Group
